item.title: Embracing Death
item.description:
I wrote this presentation for a weekend futurist getaway where everyone gives talks about their topic of interest. With so much focus on overcoming death, I thought I’d take the naturalist perpective for a moment and look at the evolutionary advantages of death, integrating machine learning models to support their claims.

The major rebuttal to my arguments were:

  • that my quantized model of individuality limits how many memories we can store. Why not store all information ever experienced in highest resolution?

My answer is similar to why too many regulations slow down innovation. Why do we care about garbage collecting? There comes a point where information is no longer relevant. The individual doesn’t need it. It’s fine if the collective conscious stores an archived memory of it(historical documents in a library) that we can refer to, but I am glad this information is stored elsewhere. The ‘individual’ should be agile, ever changing in the most dynamic way possible.

  • How do I ensure goodness or prevent the evil AI?
